comments:
I20050329-2000

NPE logged while my connection was lost.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 4 2 2005-03-31 12:14:04.850
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "CVS QuickDiff: fetching remote
contents".
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.ui.ide.ResourceUtil.getFile(ResourceUtil.java:47)
	at
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.RemoteRevisionQuickDiffProvider.getFileFromEditor(RemoteRevisionQuickDiffProvider.java:322)
	at
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.RemoteRevisionQuickDiffProvider.computeChange(RemoteRevisionQuickDiffProvider.java:204)
	at
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.RemoteRevisionQuickDiffProvider.readDocument(RemoteRevisionQuickDiffProvider.java:245)
	at
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.RemoteRevisionQuickDiffProvider.access$4(RemoteRevisionQuickDiffProvider.java:241)
	at
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.RemoteRevisionQuickDiffProvider$3.run(RemoteRevisionQuickDiffProvider.java:340)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:67)

This doesn't appear to have anything to do with connectivity. Was this just 
after startup? The NPE is happening because the editor input is null. I wonder 
if the quick diff is happening before the editor has been restored.

Upon further investigation, it can't be an unrestored editor. We check to make 
sure that the editor has an editor input when the editor for the quick diff 
provider is set. Somehow, at a later point, the editor has no editor input. 
Could it have occurred during shutdown?

I did make changes in this area (related to obtaining files from editor 
inputs). I've changed the code to work as it did before (i.e. if there is no 
editor input, null is returned).
What's the consequence of the NPE? Isn't this an M6 candidate?

I don't know. Is this reproducable for you? Can you give me any information 
that would help me reproduce it? Did you see any funtionality loss? If not, 
then I don't see any reason to consider it for M6.
On second thought, the fix is pretty safe. I'll put it in.

I'm pretty sure it happend while my connection got lost and it wasn't during a
start or shutdown scenario. What I saw when there was no connection was that the
history view stayed empty but that's probably not related.
